findings.title: Improperly designed addPool function
findings.description: In the _addPool_ function, the owner can set the value of share to true. If it is set to true, the user's funds will be locked in the contract.

findings.title: User funds may be locked in contracts
findings.description: In the _addPool_ function, if the owner sets the value of share to true, user's funds will be locked in the contract.

findings.title: Rewards may be calculated as zero
findings.description: In the MultiStaker contract, since the precision of the reward token is used to calculate the reward, if the precision of the reward token is smaller than the precision of the stake token, the user's reward may be zero.

findings.title: Improperly designed setActivityInfo function
findings.description: If the pool is not updated, it may cause confusion in calculating the user's reward.

findings.title: Lack event trigger
findings.description: The following functions are missing event triggering.

findings.title: Redundant codes
findings.description: It is recommended to delete relevant redundant codes.

findings.title: Will result in the user's staking tokens being issued as reward tokens
findings.description: In the _addPool_ function, it is not strictly judged that the stake token is a reward token.

findings.title: When updating the reward block of the pool, the user's previous reward should be settled
findings.description: If the pool is not updated, it may cause confusion in calculating the user's reward.

findings.title: Unnecessary Memory Object Declaration
findings.description: There is no need to declare a memory object in the contract to obtain data.
